titleStmt.title: An essay towards the theory of the intelligible world intuitively considered designed for forty-nine parts : Part III : consisting of a preface, a postscript, and a little something between / by Gabriel John ; enriched with a faithful account of his ideal voyage, and illustrated with poems by several hands, as likewise with other strange things not insufferably clever, nor furiously to the purpose.
titleStmt.author: D'Urfey, Thomas, 1653-1723.

publicationStmt.date: Printed in the year one thousand seven hundred, &c.

notesStmt.note: Attributed to Thomas D'Urfey. Cf. Wing, BM.
A satire on John Norris' An essay towards the theory of the ideal or intelligible world.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
